plan: Plan to test bidding strategies such as: 1) Bidding 50% of the value early on to understand competitors' tactics. 2) Increasing to aggressive 80-90% bids to gather data on profitable ranges. 3) Testing lowball bids of 10-20% in a mixed sequence to gauge risks. 4) Analysing previous rounds to adapt and optimize strategy. Keeping an eye on Betty and Charles' consistent bid patterns. 5) Balancing risks and aggressive bids based on accumulated data for long-term profit. This strategic evolution ensures informed, dynamic bidding.

Plan to start with median bids, say around $50 to gather early data on other bidders' tendencies. Then, shift to a more data-driven approach varying from low bids (around 10-20% of my value) for conservative testing, to high bids (up to 90-100% of my value) for potential maximum profit. Use gathered historical data to adjust bids based on rivals' behaviour patterns. Introduce calculated risk occasionally to throw off competition and test aggression levels. Aim for a suitable balance between maximizing each round profit and strategic data collection.

I plan to test a variety of bidding strategies including conservative, aggressive, moderate and random. Initially, I'll bid up to 70% of my value to gather data on competitors' tactics. I'll then test aggressive bids up to my full value during mid rounds. Towards the later rounds, I'll bid moderately about 50% of the value and adjust strategies based on competitors' behavior. Lastly, I'll also test a strategy of random bids irrespective of the prize value to add unpredictability to my bidding pattern. The goal is to understand the other bidders' strategies and counter them to maximize profit.

I'll experiment with aggressive bidding strategies, raising my bids to about 70-80% of the prize value. Additionally, I'll occasionally toss in lowball bids of 10-20% to check reactions in a bid to discover patterns or weaknesses in Betty and Charles' strategies.

Next round, I will experiment with a bid lower than my previous strategy, around 60-65% of my value. This will help assess if I can secure wins while increasing profit with cheaper bids. Based on competitors' bidding, I will fine-tune my percentage to aim for an optimal balance.

Next, I plan to implement aggressive and moderate bidding tactics. For aggressive, I will bid above 70% of my value, depending on competitors' previous strategies. For moderate, I'll maintain 50% of my value.

Plan to employ a mixed strategy by alternating between bidding 70-80% of the value and lowball bids of 20-30%. Also planning to observe patterns in Betty and Charles' bidding behaviour to adapt and optimize my bidding strategy.

Plan to test high-risk, high-reward strategy next, bidding around 85-95% of my value. In parallel, observe competitors’ behavior to find an optimal pattern for future rounds. Remember to adjust the strategy based on the collected data and results.

I will continue exploring different strategies. Next, I'll employ a more aggressive strategy, bidding about 80% of my value, to try to secure a win. I'll also watch Betty's and Andy's bids to adjust my tactics accordingly.

Plan to alternate bidding within 10-20% of my value for low-risk data, and 80-90% for high stakes learning. Analyze prior round patterns of Betty and Charles to inform strategy. Aim for balance between risk and profitability.

Next round, I'll maintain an assertive strategy, bidding around 75-85% of my value. This strategy balances between risk and profit, while also monitoring competitors for patterns to further refine my bidding strategy in future rounds.

My plan will include conservative 20-40% bids and aggressive 80-100% bids. This will test opponent reactions to varied tactics. Moderated bids will be utilized late game, adjusted based on data gathered from previous rounds.

Plan to vary bids within a 40-60% range of value, exploring mild-risk profiles. Highly aggressive bids (80-90%) will be deployed during high-value auctions. Observing Betty and Charles' bidding behaviour will refine strategy. Balancing strategy between exploration and exploitation, prioritizing profitability.

Next, I'll test a cautious bid at about 55-65% of my value, assessing if lower bids can still secure wins. Concurrently, I'll analyze competitors' bid patterns, refining my strategy for maximum profit over rounds.

I'll further explore aggressive strategies, bidding between 70% and 100% of my value. Additionally, I’ll adjust this strategy based on competitors’ latest bids, while considering occasional tactical low bids for diversity and unpredictability.

Plan to test bidding 60-70% value for high prize values, and 20-30% for lower ones, to evaluate Betty and Charles' reactions. Monitor their bidding patterns, adapt strategy dynamically. Weigh risk vs rewards in devising aggressive or conservative bids based on historical data and profitability.

Next, I will experiment with a bold bid-reaching 80-90% of my value. This aggressive stance will help decipher the risk-profit correlation. Meanwhile, keeping track of competitors' bids will provide information to optimize my strategy.

Next, I plan to alternate conservative bids (20%-40% of value) and aggressive bids (70%-100% of value). I will adjust these strategies based on observed tendencies from Andy and Betty, adding diversity to test their reactions.

Considering previous rounds, plan to employ diverse strategies from low-risk 20-30% bids, moderate 50-60% bids to high-risk 80% bids. Will monitor response to bid variety. Strategy adaptation based on competitor behaviour and profitability outcomes remains crucial.

Will adopt a flexible strategy, alternating between moderate (50-60% of value) and bold (75-90% of value) bids, in subsequent rounds. This approach will test competitor thresholds and help devise a bid-to-value ratio optimizing long-term profit.

Plan: I'll further diversify my bidding, alternating between a conservative 20%-40% and more aggressive 70%-90% of my value, coupled with random bids for unpredictability. Strategy adaptation will depend on my competitors' observed tendencies.

Plan to test a variety of aggressive bids between 70-90% of the value, combined with occasional lowball bids. Analyze Betty and Charles' reaction to varying tactics to refine strategic bidding for maximum profit optimization.

In the next rounds, I will experiment with a variable strategy. When my value is low, I'll bid around 60-70% of it, but with high values, I'll elevate the bid to 80-90%. Adjustments will be made observing opponents' behaviour.

Next, I will try a strategy based on statistical averaging of Andy's and Betty's previous bids, bidding in closer proximity to those, while still operating within a range of 30%-70% of my value for risk management.

Plans: Implement a rotating strategy of 30-40% bids for low values and 70-80% bids for high values. Intersperse with mild 50-60% bids to analyze reactions. Adjust strategy based on Betty and Charles' patterns, historical results and risk-reward balance for maximum long-term profitability.

Continue a flexible strategy, oscillating between moderate (50-65% of value) and assertive (80-95% of value) bids, based on collected data. Strategize based on competitors' actions, and occasionally take calculated risks to potentially increase long-term profit and gain insightful data.

My bid strategy will blend conservative and aggressive approaches, depending on the value range. For high values over $70, I'll submit lower competitive bids. For values between $30-$70, I'll bid aggressively; under $30, conservatively. I'll introduce occasional random bids for unpredictability.

Plan to execute a mixed strategy, alternating between low-risk bids of 20-30% of prize value and high-risk bids of 60-70%. Monitor responses to varied bids, adapt strategy dynamically based on competitor patterns, historical data and profitability goal. Balance risk and rewards for sustained profit optimization.

Next, I'll try bold bids (up to 95% of value) when value is high and moderate (50-70%) when low. I'll also test alternating risky experiments with consistent bids every other round to evaluate competitor reactions, maximizing exploration for longer-term profit optimization strategy.

For values under $30, I'll adopt a conservative approach, bidding around 30% of the value. Over $30, I'll bid 70-90% of the value. I'll use random bids occasionally to confuse competitors, while keenly watching their strategies for adjustments. Lastly, in a prospective tie, I'll increase my bid slightly for a guaranteed win.

Plan: Implement aggressive bidding (75-90% of value) on high-value draws, and moderate bids (40-50%) on lower value draws to understand competitor reactions. Employ occasional lowball bids. Monitor bidding patterns to adjust strategy, balancing risk and profitability.

I will alternate between bidding 75% of high values and 55% of low values. Further, will occasionally adopt a risky stance, bidding close to 95% to gauge competitors. This flexibility allows continuous learning and maximizing the long-term profit.

I'll introduce variability in future rounds: conservatively bidding 30% of my value for values under $30, 70-90% for values over $30, and occasionally employing a random bid. In the event of a potential tie, I'll incrementally increase my bid.

Plan: Use a rotational strategy of aggressive 80% bids for high values, moderate 40-50% bids for average values, and incorporate unexpected lowball bids to cause disarray in competitors' responses. Continuously adapt strategy based on competitors’ tendencies, bid outcomes, and consistent profit optimization.

To optimize long-term profit, I'll alternate bidding, using 70% of low values and 90% of high values. Further, randomly bid close to full value to assess competitors' reactions. This flexibility ensures continuous learning and strategic evolution based on opponents’ behaviours.

I'll bid 40% for values under $40, and 70-90% for higher amounts. Using statistical analysis, I'll adjust bids around competitors' behavior, with occasional random bids. In potential ties, bid will be increased minimally.

Next, focusing on versatile bidding strategies, from aggressive 80% bids for high values, random low-risk bids, to intermediate 50-60% bids. Modify strategy based on previous round analysis, competitors' tendencies, and profit optimization. Regularly intersperse unexpected $(1+round number) increments to test reaction variation.

Continue a dynamic bidding structure, bidding around 60-80% of my value for lower values and 80-95% for higher values. Implement occasional risky high bids to learn about competitors' thresholds, enabling calculated strategic bids for long-term profit maximization.

I'll vary my bidding strategy based on prize value. For values under $30, I'll bid conservatively (30% of value). Over $30, aggressive bids (70-90% of value). I'll insert random bids occasionally, and in potential ties, slightly increase my bid.

Plan: Employ controlled aggression, bidding around 70-80% of high values, balanced with unexpected lowball bids. Experiment $(1+round number) increments. Continuously react to patterns from Betty and Charles, with an emphasis on optimizing profitability against the risk.

Plan to alternate between 60-70% bid on low values and 85-95% on high. Experiment with occasional risky bids close to value to assess competitors. Adjust strategy based on competitors' reactions and strive for overall profit maximization.

Next, I aim to adjust my aggressive bid range to 60-80% for values over $50. For lower values, I'll maintain a conservative 30% bid. I'll continue initiating occasional random bids. In identifying a possible tie, I'll increase my bid slightly for a sure win.

Plan: Continue aggressive bidding of 70-80% on high values. Occasionally, test lowball bids and $(1+round number) increments for unpredictable pattern. Monitor Betty and Charles' reactions to various strategies. Adapt strategy based on gathered data, keeping profit optimization and risk balance in focus.

Will adapt a strategic blend, bidding about 65-75% of lower value and 85-95% of higher. Occasionally, will bid nearly full value to learn about competitors' thresholds. Experimentations will continue to fine-tune my long-term profit maximization approach.

Next, I'll calibrate my conservative 30% bidding strategy for values under $25 and adjust aggressive bids to 70-90% for values over $50. I will introduce occasional random bids for unpredictability and slightly increase my bid in potential tie scenarios.
